name: market for electricity, low voltage | electricity, low voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/16157/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset describes the electricity available on the high voltage level in India, Eastern grid. This is done by showing the transmission of 1kWh electricity at high voltage.;The shares of electricity technologies on this market are valid for the year 2020-21. The fiscal year in India starts on 1 April 2020 and ends 31 March 2021. The shares been calculated by the data provider and don't correspond with the production volumes entered in the undefined datasets of the different electricity supplying technologies. The shares have been calculated based on statistics from 2020-21:;Electricity generation data is sourced from:;- General Review 2022, All India Electricity Statistics containing data for the year 2020-21, Central Electricity Authority, 2022;Technology splits are calculated based on:;- S&P Global (2021). Platts World Electric Power Plant database (WEPP), version December 2021. https://www.spglobal.com;- The windpower (2022). Wind farms. https://www.thewindpower.net/windfarms_list_en.php;- For hydro the technology split was determined through individual research For each power plant.;Regional import are calculated based on:;- Grid-India (2021). Grid Controller of India Limited. URL: https://posoco.in/reports/monthly-reports/

This activity starts from 1kWh of electricity fed into the medium voltage transmission network.

This activity ends with the transport of 1 kWh of low voltage electricity in the transmission network.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The 'Start of Period' and 'End of Period' do not refer to the year for which this market is valid. See general comment for the year for which the technology shares are based on.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This geography represents an Indian regional grid India - North-eastern grid.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average technology used to transmit and distribute electricity. Includes underground and overhead lines, as well as air-, vacuum- and SF6-insulated high-to-medium voltage switching stations. Electricity production according to related technology datasets.;Definition of the voltage levels:;- High voltage level above 24 kV (large scale industry);- Medium voltage level between 1 kV and 24 kV (medium to small scale industry, service sector;and public buildings);- Low voltage level below 1 kV (Households)
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Assumptions for the amount of transmission network per kWh transported and emissions per kWh are based on Swiss data. Electricity losses data are based on Central Electricity Authority (CEA), India data and on data from Switzerland (see parameters).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The inventory is generated using statistical data, literature data and modelling.

flow.name: sulfur hexafluoride, liquid

defaultProvider.name: market for sulfur hexafluoride, liquid | sulfur hexafluoride, liquid | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description: Literature value/estimation. SF6 (sulphur hexafluoride) is used as quenching and insulation gas in gas-insulated switchgear. SF6 has physically ideal properties for the use in high and medium voltage switchgear. About 5% of SF6-emissions are caused by the medium voltage level switchgear, which are allocated to the electricity demand on low voltage. The emission rate has been taken from UBA (1999) Schwefelhexafluorid. Retrieved 14.8.2002 from: http://www.ubavie.gv.at/publikationen/uba-aktuell/archiv/1999/08/SF6.html.

Estimation. Data overtaken from Switzerland. Swiss data are calculated values based on the electricity transported in this voltage level (36796 GWh) and the total low voltage power line length in Switzerland (cables and aerial lines - 128646 km). Lifetime is assumed to be 40 years. See Itten&Frischknecht 2012, Tab. 4.1 and Tab. 4.3.
